CustomField.description:
1 - Download Apex Data Loader. Setup >> Data Management >> Data Loader. Use it to craft and test a SELECT statement. Conga Merge only supports SELECT statements. (No object traversing, no nested Selects -- just simple queries.)
(3) In the SOQL query's WHERE clause, you may include a parameter from the PointMerge master object by using '{pv0}'. For example: ...WHERE AccountId='{pv0}'
SOQL requires that text values in WHERE clauses must be enclosed with apostrophes.
A complete example might look like the following. (This finds all of the contacts at a given account.) SELECT LastName, FirstName, Phone, CreatedDate, Account.Name FROM Contact WHERE AccountId = '{pv0}'
(4) Copy and paste the SELECT query into a Query record.
(5) Copy the Query record's Id to the clipboard to use in the PointMerge URL. The PointMerge URL will then contain a QueryId parameter:
...&QueryId=1234657890?pv0={!Account.Id}
